attributes.action: ask the Crown Commissioners to protect Bates The Hatter of Jermyn Street.  To accommodate them elsewhere on the street for 3 years free of charge as their historic business will be so badly damaged by moving from their traditional home.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Bates the Hatters.  A shop for Londoners and some lucky tourists.  The site on which it sits is part of plans by the crown commissioners to redevelop the historic Jermyn Street, famed for its quality, independent mens outfitters. 
The commissioners have these businesses now on short lessees.  They intend expelling them for three years and there is no promise of rent levels or lease length upon return.  No small business could stand that. 
Bates can never make vast profits but (like the crown itself) it adds to the colour, the history and the fun of London; a proper affordable men's hat shop.
 If the Crown Commissioners can't defend that then they have no right owning and managing these huge swathes of land in London

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
